bibl.title: Two Unknown Ptolemaic Portraits in the Archaeological Museum in Cracow (Poland).
bibl.note: Two objects in the Archaeological Museum in Cracow from the so-called "Field Museum", which was founded by Polish soldiers fighting during World War II in the ranks of the British Forces: alabaster torso of young man (h. 15 cm), depicting probably Ptolemy V Epiphanes; terracotta head (h. 7 cm), presumably a portrait of the same ruler.

bibl.title: Patrizia MINÀ (coordinamento e redazione), Faraoni come dei, Tolemei come faraoni. Atti del V Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano, Torino, Archivio di Stato, 8-12 dicembre 2001

bibl.seg: SZYMANSKA Hanna, Two Unknown Ptolemaic Portraits in the Archaeological Museum in Cracow (Poland).

Nicola BONACASA, Anna Maria DONADONI ROVERI, Sergio AIOSA e Patrizia MINÀ (a cura di), Patrizia MINÀ (coordinamento e redazione), Faraoni come dei, Tolemei come faraoni. Atti del V Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano, Torino, Archivio di Stato, 8-12 dicembre 2001 (Torino - Palermo, 2003) pp. 501-507, 2 pll.

Two objects in the Archaeological Museum in Cracow from the so-called "Field Museum", which was founded by Polish soldiers fighting during World War II in the ranks of the British Forces: alabaster torso of young man (h. 15 cm), depicting probably Ptolemy V Epiphanes; terracotta head (h. 7 cm), presumably a portrait of the same ruler.
